channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Venezuela's exiles in Chile caught between hope and uncertainty
item.description: Initial joy among Venezuela's diaspora in Chile has given way to caution, as questions grow over what Maduro's capture means for the country — and for those who fled it.
item.content:encoded:
Initial joy among Venezuela's diaspora in Chile has given way to caution, as questions grow over what Maduro's capture means for the country — and for those who fled it.

(Image credit: JAVIER TORRES)
item.dc:creator: John Bartlett

item.title: Inside a Gaza medical clinic at risk of shutting down after an Israeli ban
item.description: A recent Israeli decision to bar Doctors Without Borders and other aid groups means international staff and aid can no longer enter Gaza or the West Bank. Local staff must rely on dwindling supplies and no international expertise.
item.content:encoded:
A recent Israeli decision to bar Doctors Without Borders and other aid groups means international staff and aid can no longer enter Gaza or the West Bank. Local staff must rely on dwindling supplies and no international expertise.

(Image credit: Anas Baba/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Iran warns US troops and Israel will be targets if America strikes over protests as death toll rises
item.description: Iran's parliament speaker warned the U.S. military and Israel would be "legitimate targets" if America strikes the Islamic Republic, as threatened by President Donald Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Iran's parliament speaker warned the U.S. military and Israel would be "legitimate targets" if America strikes the Islamic Republic, as threatened by President Donald Trump.

(Image credit: UGC)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Nationwide anti-ICE protests call for accountability after Renee Good's death
item.description: Activist organizations are planning at least 1,000 protests and vigils this weekend. Officials in major cities cast Saturday's demonstrations as largely peaceful.
item.content:encoded:
Activist organizations are planning at least 1,000 protests and vigils this weekend. Officials in major cities cast Saturday's demonstrations as largely peaceful.

(Image credit: Ben Hovland)
item.dc:creator: Chandelis Duster

item.title: Veteran actor T.K. Carter, known for 'The Thing' and 'Punky Brewster,' dies at 69
item.description: T.K. Carter gained fame as Nauls the cook in John Carpenter's 1982 horror classic, "The Thing."
item.content:encoded:
T.K. Carter gained fame as Nauls the cook in John Carpenter's 1982 horror classic, "The Thing."

(Image credit: Mary Altaffer)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Who is Reza Pahlavi, the exiled crown prince encouraging demonstrations across Iran?
item.description: In exile for nearly 50 years, Iran's Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi has issued calls urging Iranians to join protests sweeping the country. But support for him may not be clear cut.
item.content:encoded:
In exile for nearly 50 years, Iran's Crown Prince Reza Pahlavi has issued calls urging Iranians to join protests sweeping the country. But support for him may not be clear cut.

(Image credit: Thomas Padilla)
item.dc:creator: Willem Marx

item.title: US launches new retaliatory strikes against ISIS in Syria after deadly ambush
item.description: The U.S. has launched another round of strikes against the Islamic State in Syria. This follows last month's ambush that killed two U.S. soldiers and an American civilian interpreter.
item.content:encoded:
The U.S. has launched another round of strikes against the Islamic State in Syria. This follows last month's ambush that killed two U.S. soldiers and an American civilian interpreter.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 6 killed in Mississippi shooting rampage, authorities say
item.description: The alleged gunman, 24, has been charged with murder after the Friday shootings in northeast Mississippi. The victims include his father, uncle, brother and a 7-year-old relative, authorities said.
item.content:encoded: The alleged gunman, 24, has been charged with murder after the Friday shootings in northeast Mississippi. The victims include his father, uncle, brother and a 7-year-old relative, authorities said.
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: Washington National Opera leaves Kennedy Center, joining slew of artist exits
item.description: The WNO is just the latest to say they will no longer perform at the Kennedy Center since Trump took over last year.
item.content:encoded: The WNO is just the latest to say they will no longer perform at the Kennedy Center since Trump took over last year.
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Ukrainian drones set fire to Russian oil depot after Moscow launches new hypersonic missile
item.description: The strike comes a day after Russia bombarded Ukraine with hundreds of drones and dozens of missiles, including a powerful new hypersonic missile that hit western Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
The strike comes a day after Russia bombarded Ukraine with hundreds of drones and dozens of missiles, including a powerful new hypersonic missile that hit western Ukraine.

(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
